condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes

description.narrative: UNICEF Ethiopia signed Rolling Work Plans with its Government Implementing Partners for the first time in its history. The Rolling Work Plans (RWPs) have a two years timeframe allowing longer term sequencing of activities. The higher level strategic RWP activities will strengthen the focus on results and improve efficiency and effectiveness by reducing the time spent on work plan preparation. This will also improve monitoring and reporting as the core activities are consistent across all regions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Number of open spot check recommendations
The CMT reviews the status of implementation of the Compact on a bi-annual basis
